sentences.sContent: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.sCn: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.sContent: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.sCn: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.sContent: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.sCn: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.sContent: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.sCn: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.sContent: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .

phrases.pCn: 反向抵押贷款；反向抵押；反向贷款；倒按揭

remMethod.val: mort(死) + gage(誓言； 抵押) → 以东西做抵押， 以免交易失败 → 抵押贷款

words.tran: [会计] 承受抵押人；押入者贷款人

trans.tranCn: 抵押贷款，按揭；抵押证书
trans.tranOther: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it
